abstract: Carl C. Icahn has bought a $122 million stake in CSX, joining Warren Buffett and TCI Fund Management in purchasing railroad shares. Mr. Icahn held 2.68 million shares of Jacksonville, Fla.-based CSX, the nation’s third-largest railroad, as of March 31, according to filings Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Mr. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway and hedge fund TCI also detailed their purchases in the industry, which they disclosed in the past month.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn has bought a $122 million stake in CSX, joining Warren Buffett and TCI Fund Management in purchasing railroad shares. Mr. Icahn held 2.68 million shares of Jacksonville, Fla.-based CSX, the nation’s third-largest railroad, as of March 31, according to filings Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Mr. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway and hedge fund TCI also detailed their purchases in the industry, which they disclosed in the past month.

headline.main: Like Buffett, Icahn’s Working on the Railroads
